thread.title: Watch Alex Trebek Rap Drake, Lil Wayne, and Kendrick Lamar on 'Jeopardy!'
thread.title_full: Watch Alex Trebek Rap Drake, Lil Wayne, and Kendrick Lamar on 'Jeopardy!'

author: Matt Miller
title: Watch Alex Trebek Rap Drake, Lil Wayne, and Kendrick Lamar on 'Jeopardy!'
text:
Alex Trebek's First Mixtape Is Going to Be Fire 
Watch him rap Desiigner, Lil Wayne, Kendrick Lamar, and more on Jeopardy! Most Popular By Matt Miller Feb 21, 2017 Jeopardy! has been on TV for 53 years. And for 33 of those years, Alex Trebek has very carefully read the answers to thousands of questions off of those bright blue screens. The show has survived through cold wars, through Beatle invasions, through the rise and fall of Who Wants to Be a Millionaire? , and kept up with five-decades of trends along the way. That the show has kept its finger on the pulse of pop culture has only added to its longevity. It remains timeless because it never tries to be something it's not. Trebek hasn't been replaced with a younger model. The set has maintained the same aesthetic design. The show has never introduced a singing competition or an immunity challenge. Advertisement - Continue Reading Below But Jeopardy! is also self-aware. It knows that Trebek, in his conservative suit with his now iconic enunciation, will sound hilarious while attempting to rap. Jeopardy! rarely takes part in viral Internet culture, but even its producers have figured out when a Jeopardy! moment will blow up on the Internet. That's the genius of this clip from Monday night's episode, which is all over social media today. Jeopardy! will never change—only we will. Most Popular It was only a matter of time until the Internet put the actual beats under Trebek's voice. I took Alex Trebek rapping on Jeopardy and did the only thing that felt right: Edit it to the music he was quoting. (: @KennyDucey ) pic.twitter.com/Tg8mxONBAj
